intro: Vahlia geminiflora, commonly known as the twin-flowered vahlia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a reddish tint. Vahlia geminiflora is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
